intro: Sayeria neglecta, commonly known as the neglected sayeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Sayeria neglecta is often found in the understory of forests and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
